alert.note: Alert for Woodruff (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 31 at 3:17PM CDT until further notice by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM CDT FOR WEST CENTRAL WOODRUFF...NORTH CENTRAL PRAIRIE AND SOUTHEASTERN WHITE COUNTIES... At 316 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 7 miles northeast of Thurman, or 12 miles northwest of Des Arc, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. This is the same storm that produced a confirmed tornado earlier. Radar is unable to confirm a tornado at this time. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... Augusta... West Point... Pryor... Hurricane Lake WMA... Garner... Griffithville... Dixie... Vinity Corner... Walker... McClelland... Gregory... Worden... Jasmine... Georgetown... TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
